config:
{
	"phones":2,
	"nodes":2
}


Commands:
call 0000 0001
node_malfunction Node_1
call 0000 0001



Expected behaviour:
Node_1 is offline, so phones should be connected through Node_0.



Curreny behaviour:
Node_1 is offline, but phones still connect through Node_1.

Full output:
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: available
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: ready
Phone 0001: ready
-----=====-----
Command: 
call 0000 0001
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: available
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: dialing 0001 through Node_1
Phone 0001: ringing from 0000 through Node_1
-----=====-----
Command: 
node_malfunction Node_1
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: unavailable
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: ready
Phone 0001: ready
-----=====-----
Command: 
call 0000 0001
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: unavailable
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: dialing 0001 through Node_1
Phone 0001: ringing from 0000 through Node_1
-----=====-----
Command: 
answer Node_1
There is no phone with address Node_1
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: unavailable
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: dialing 0001 through Node_1
Phone 0001: ringing from 0000 through Node_1
-----=====-----
Command: 
answer 000 
There is no phone with address 000
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: unavailable
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: dialing 0001 through Node_1
Phone 0001: ringing from 0000 through Node_1
-----=====-----
Command: 
answer 0001
-----=====-----
Node Node_0: available
Node Node_1: unavailable
-----=====-----
Phone 0000: calling 0001 through Node_1
Phone 0001: calling 0000 through Node_1
-----=====-----
